subject: linear_algebra
title: Particular and Homogeneous Solutions
contentHtml: In linear algebra, we often encounter systems of linear equations that have multiple solutions or no solutions at all. This theorem helps us understand when a system has a unique solution, and how to find it.

theorem.statement: \[If A is an m x n matrix with rank(A) = r, then the system Ax = b has a unique solution if and only if the nullity of A is zero.\]
theorem.proofSketch: The proof involves showing that if the nullity is non-zero, there exists a non-trivial solution to the homogeneous equation Ax = 0.

intuition: This theorem tells us when we can expect a unique solution for a system of linear equations. It's essential in many applications, including machine learning and computer graphics.
realWorldApplications: Finding the optimal parameters for a neural network
